p: Severe Acute Respiratory Syndrome (SARS) appeared in China in 2002 as a contagious disease caused by Coronavirus (CoV) through contact with respiratory droplets and exposure to different fomites. Named SARS-CoV, the virus triggers clinical features such as fever followed by respiratory signs and symptoms that progress rapidly to the asymptomatic infection with atypical pneumonia and respiratory failure [ [1], [2], [3], [4], [5]].
